DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Whole Body Positron Emission Tomography Evaluation Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a diagnostic assessment or evaluation of the entire body using Positron Emission Tomography, a computerized image of the metabolic activity of body tissues used to determine the presence of disease, was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Whole Body Positron Emission Tomography Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic assessment or evaluation of the entire body using Positron Emission Tomography, a computerized image of the metabolic activity of body tissues used to determine the presence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Whole Body Positron Emission Tomography Evaluation
Property.preferredDefinition: Whole; including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.:The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.:A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
